Translations.Text: Under obligation to lelaf of Quraish
their lêlaf (travel documents to give protection) to the flight (movement of caravans) during winter and summer
so they must pay obedience to (the) Nourisher-Sustainer of this Al-Baiyt [The House (Ka‘ba at Makka)] —
to That (Allah) Who provided them food against hunger, and kept them safe against fear (of every lawlessness)
Have you watched him who denies the Accountability
So that is the one who harshly drives away Al-Yatim
And urges not for providing food to the indigent
Woe to those who offer Salat —
those: they are in error regarding their salat (canonical Prayer)
those: they (offer Prayers and only) act to be seen
and (also) reject (and refuse) Al-Ma‘un (small, routine requests from people around them)
Surely We, We bestowed you Al-Kauthar. ['The Abundance' (of good). This is an Attribute for Allah's Book. See

Therefore offer Salat devoted to your Nourisher-Sustainer; and take part in Nahr (‘piercing the chest with bayonets’ or ‘piercing a sharp, pointed cutting instrument in the carotid artery at the neck’)

Surely, the enemy charged with hatred towards you: he (is) put to rout, (and is) made extinct. [See article – 'The detailed format of the Scripture (Rabt-e-Suwar)' in Prolegomenon for discussion on Nahr
